resources.string: Answer the following 10 questions and check how you did in comparison with a nationally representative group of 3,278 randomly selected U.S. adults who did the same quiz.
Press [CHECK] button to see how you did then [RESULTS] button for details on your score
%s out of 10 questions were correct\nRed question box indicate a mistake
You answered correctly to %s of 10 questions.
See below how your results compare with the 3,278 randomly sampled adults that also answered to the same questions during a national survey in the U.S.
Congratulations %s\nYou managed to answer correctly to %s out of 10 quiz questions.\nWe are happy you took our quiz - SQ Team
1. This picture shows an object in space that has an icy core with a tail of gas and dust that extends millions of miles. What is this?
2. What kind of waves are used to make and receive cellphone calls?
3. This picture shows three layers of the Earth. Which layer is the hottest?
4. Which of these is the main way that ocean tides are created?
Rotation of the Earth on its axis
Large ships sailing on the surface
The gravitational pull of the Moon
The gravitational pull of the Sun
6. Madrid (Spain) is located 670m above sea level, Venice (Italy) just 1m above sea level. Which of these statements is correct?
Water boils at lower temperature in Madrid than in Venice
Water boils at higher temperature in Madrid than in Venice
Water does not boil in Venice
7. Which of these pictures best illustrates what happens when light passes through a magnifying glass?
8. What unit is used to describe sound pressure level in acoustics as well as power to amplitude ratio (gain) in electronics?
9. Which of the following are not formal scientific disciplines? (multiple answers can be correct)
10. Which of these elements can be used to make nuclear energy and nuclear weapons? (multiple answers can be correct)
